class whether it's standard standard and frequent access or reduced rency storage and then you can Trend you can see the

wash alarm so you get an email notification when you pass that threshold so you can take specific action on that um another piece of

now track uh who is creating my buckets or who is changing policies on my bucket when are they doing it where they're

a service or or web uh websites and we uh web services on on S3 um told us that
that for for some use cases it's easier for them to actually put their customer data in specific buckets that way they
not only get to track building for specific customers separately but they can also potentially manage uh the

Enterprise customers who who are transitioning and moving thousands of applications onto AWS and Amazon S3 and
and in in those cases as well if if I can isolate my HR data in one bucket and finance data and another I can easily

those use cases uh by default we have 100 bucket limit on on ads and this year we announced that we can increase that

S3 provides is is eventual consistency when you update and remove your object so think about you know doing multiple
delete operations perhaps on on on exactly the same key at exactly the same time the system needs to be able to
handle that um and and one of the ways we handle this is uh providing eventual consistency so no matter how many
operations you do on any given object or set of objects in S3 eventually all clients and all consumers of of that
data will see a consistent State U that's true for updates and deletes uh but there are certain workflows where
actually makes sense uh to be able to uh write a new object and then be able to read that immediately you know think big
data workloads where you want to write a whole bunch of files onto your S3 bucket but now your application actually has to wait uh for for that eventual eventually
consistent state to be achieved and you know that's a bit of a pain Point uh so this year we announced that for all
endpoints and all regions on Amazon S3 we now have read after write consistency so you can put in a new object on Amazon
S3 and then immediately read that without having to worry about uh not finding that object it will always be
there available for you so that's a that's a very quick look at some of the things that that we've launched and some

ability to trigger an event um when an object is deleted and removed we also added the ability to filter when you

bucket and say all files with the extension Fu uh let's say all video files I only want to trigger uh
notification when a video file gets added to a specific prefix so that way I have a lot more control over when a
specific notification gets triggered or I could trigger separate notification that take different actions and have different workflows triggered um and you
know prior to event notifications a lot of our customers were either building proxy services so you might you might be
polling your S3 bucket to see if there's any changes any object that got removed by mistake or something you didn't
expect to to be removed so that you can take kick off specific workflows um or customers are actually writing code uh
to first um put an object in S3 wait for it to succeed and then maybe update a a secondary index for example or take some
other action or kick off some other work FL with event notifications my my application code is actually super
simple I don't need to write these proxy Services I can simply configure and hook up my event notification to trigger the
right kind of notification whether it's an SNS topic or an sqs Q where my application might be reading from that
